message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you a unique product that I think you'll love. I'm thinking of selling it to you for $150.
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $120. Is that something you'd be willing to consider?

I appreciate your interest in the product, Bob. However, I was thinking more along the lines of $140. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I need to make a profit. Would you be willing to consider this price?
I appreciate your flexibility, but I'm still a bit higher than that. How about $110?

I understand you're trying to get a good deal, Bob. However, I've already compromised on the price. I'm willing to meet you at $130, but I don't think I can go any lower than that. Would you be willing to meet me in the middle?
I appreciate your flexibility, but I'm still a bit higher than that. How about $115?

I'm starting to get a bit concerned that we're getting stuck in a loop, Bob. I'm willing to make one more concession. I'll meet you at $125, but that's as low as I can go. After this, I'll have to consider other options.
I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but I'm still a bit higher than that. How about $112.50?

I've made a significant concession already, Bob. I'm not willing to go any lower than $128. I think this is a fair price considering the product's value. If you're still interested, I'm willing to accept this price, but I won't go any lower.
I'm really interested in the product, but I've got to be careful with my budget. How about $110?
